description: Parse text-based tree structures with indentation markers
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the DemoApp or load the application
Step 2: Locate the text input area for sitemap input
Step 3: Enter a tree structure using ├──, └──, │, or space-based indentation
Step 4: Observe that the tree is parsed and rendered in real-time
Step 5: Verify that nodes are correctly structured with proper depth hierarchy

description: Render hierarchical layouts with nested cards
steps: Step 1: Enter a multi-level tree structure in the input area
Step 2: Verify that the visualization shows nested cards
Step 3: Confirm that indentation correctly reflects tree depth
Step 4: Check that parent nodes contain their children visually

description: Apply depth-based styling with progressive colors and indentation
steps: Step 1: Create a tree with nodes at various depth levels (0, 1, 2, 3+)
Step 2: Verify that top-level nodes (depth 0) have distinct color (e.g., blue)
Step 3: Confirm that sub-sections (depth 1) have different styling (e.g., white)
Step 4: Check that sub-components (depth 2+) have different styling (e.g., gray)
Step 5: Verify indentation increases with depth

description: Provide real-time preview as users type
steps: Step 1: Open the application with a sample tree loaded
Step 2: Add a new line to the tree text in the input area
Step 3: Observe that the visualization updates immediately
Step 4: Modify an existing node label
Step 5: Confirm the visualization reflects the change without page refresh

description: Detect and display parsing errors with suggestions
steps: Step 1: Enter a tree with invalid indentation (e.g., depth jump from 0 to 2)
Step 2: Verify that error messages appear in the UI
Step 3: Check that errors indicate the problematic line number
Step 4: Confirm that suggestions for fixing the error are provided
Step 5: Verify that the tree still renders with errors shown

description: Support node selection and expansion/collapse
steps: Step 1: Create a tree with nested children
Step 2: Click on a node to select it
Step 3: Verify the node becomes visually highlighted
Step 4: Click on an expand/collapse indicator
Step 5: Confirm that children are hidden/shown appropriately

description: Implement inline editing of node labels
steps: Step 1: Double-click on a node label in the visualization
Step 2: Verify an input field appears with the current label
Step 3: Modify the label text
Step 4: Press Enter or click away to save changes
Step 5: Confirm the tree text in the input area updates with new label

description: Enable keyboard navigation for tree traversal
steps: Step 1: Click on a node to focus the tree
Step 2: Press Arrow Down and verify focus moves to next node
Step 3: Press Arrow Up and verify focus moves to previous node
Step 4: Press Arrow Right on a node with children to expand
Step 5: Press Arrow Left on an expanded node to collapse

description: Search and filter nodes across the tree
steps: Step 1: Locate the search input field
Step 2: Enter a search term
Step 3: Verify matching nodes are highlighted in the tree
Step 4: Check that non-matching nodes are dimmed or filtered
Step 5: Confirm navigation between search results is possible

description: Render D3.js tree diagram with connecting lines
steps: Step 1: Switch visualization mode to D3 tree diagram
Step 2: Verify nodes are rendered with D3.js
Step 3: Check that connecting lines between parent and child nodes are visible
Step 4: Verify nodes are positioned in a tree layout
Step 5: Test interactive features like pan/zoom if available

description: Render flowchart diagram using React Flow
steps: Step 1: Switch visualization mode to flowchart
Step 2: Verify nodes are rendered as flowchart boxes
Step 3: Check that edges connect nodes appropriately
Step 4: Verify the diagram supports vertical/horizontal orientation
Step 5: Test node dragging if available in flowchart mode

description: Implement responsive layout for different screen sizes
steps: Step 1: Load the application on a desktop screen (1200px+)
Step 2: Verify the layout uses full width with multiple columns
Step 3: Resize window to tablet size (768px-1024px)
Step 4: Check that the layout adjusts to fewer columns
Step 5: Resize to mobile size (<768px) and verify single-column layout

description: Handle large sitemaps (1000+ nodes) with virtualization
steps: Step 1: Generate or load a large sitemap with 1000+ nodes
Step 2: Verify the UI remains responsive during initial load
Step 3: Scroll through the tree and verify smooth rendering
Step 4: Check that only visible nodes are rendered (virtualization)
Step 5: Confirm no significant memory or performance degradation

description: Export visualization as PNG image
steps: Step 1: Render a tree visualization in any mode
Step 2: Click the Export PNG button
Step 3: Verify a PNG file is downloaded
Step 4: Open the downloaded PNG and verify the visualization is clear
Step 5: Check that the image resolution is suitable for sharing

description: Export visualization as SVG for design tools
steps: Step 1: Render a tree visualization
Step 2: Click the Export SVG button
Step 3: Verify an SVG file is downloaded
Step 4: Open the SVG in a vector graphics editor (e.g., Figma)
Step 5: Confirm that the SVG can be edited and scaled without quality loss

description: Save and manage tree versions locally
steps: Step 1: Create or modify a tree structure
Step 2: Click the Save Version button and enter a name
Step 3: Verify the version appears in the version list
Step 4: Modify the tree and save another version
Step 5: Confirm both versions are stored and can be retrieved

description: Compare tree versions with visual diff
steps: Step 1: Save two different versions of a tree
Step 2: Select the versions to compare
Step 3: Verify a diff view is displayed side-by-side
Step 4: Check that added nodes are highlighted in one color (e.g., green)
Step 5: Confirm removed nodes are highlighted in another color (e.g., red)

description: Generate sample sitemaps for testing
steps: Step 1: Access the sitemap generator utility
Step 2: Generate a sample sitemap with specified depth and breadth
Step 3: Verify the generated tree structure matches parameters
Step 4: Check that all nodes have unique IDs
Step 5: Confirm the sitemap can be parsed correctly

description: Unit tests for tree parser with various input formats
steps: Step 1: Run the test suite with bun test or bun run test
Step 2: Verify treeParser.test.ts includes tests for ├── markers
Step 3: Check tests for └── markers and │ continuation
Step 4: Verify tests for space-based indentation
Step 5: Confirm all parser tests pass

description: Unit tests for component rendering and interaction
steps: Step 1: Run the full test suite
Step 2: Verify BasicTree.test.ts tests rendering of trees
Step 3: Check SelectableTree.test.ts tests node selection
Step 4: Verify TreeNodeComponent.test.ts tests component behavior
Step 5: Confirm all component tests pass

description: Implement collaborative editing with real-time sync
steps: Step 1: Set up WebSocket or real-time communication channel
Step 2: Implement operational transformation (OT) or CRDT for conflict resolution
Step 3: Add user presence indicators showing who is viewing/editing
Step 4: Sync tree changes in real-time across multiple users
Step 5: Test collaborative editing with multiple simultaneous users

description: Implement drag-and-drop for rearranging nodes
steps: Step 1: Create a tree with multiple nodes
Step 2: Drag a node and drop it at a new location
Step 3: Verify the node moves to the new parent/location
Step 4: Confirm the tree structure updates correctly
Step 5: Check that the text representation reflects the change

description: Add bulk operations for nodes (delete, copy, paste)
steps: Step 1: Select multiple nodes in the tree
Step 2: Use keyboard shortcuts (Ctrl+C) to copy selected nodes
Step 3: Navigate to a target location
Step 4: Use keyboard shortcuts (Ctrl+V) to paste nodes
Step 5: Verify nodes are pasted correctly with structure preserved

description: Implement advanced search with regex and wildcards
steps: Step 1: Open the search input field
Step 2: Enter a regex pattern (e.g., '.*Page$')
Step 3: Verify nodes matching the regex are highlighted
Step 4: Test wildcard patterns (e.g., 'Home*')
Step 5: Confirm search results update in real-time

description: Add custom node styling and themes
steps: Step 1: Access the theme customization settings
Step 2: Modify depth colors in the theme configuration
Step 3: Adjust typography (font size, line height)
Step 4: Customize spacing between nodes
Step 5: Verify changes apply immediately to the visualization

description: Implement plugin system for custom node types
steps: Step 1: Design plugin API for custom node types
Step 2: Create example plugin for a custom node type
Step 3: Register the plugin with the application
Step 4: Verify custom node type renders in the tree
Step 5: Test plugin lifecycle hooks and events

description: Add analytics and usage metrics tracking
steps: Step 1: Integrate analytics library (e.g., Google Analytics)
Step 2: Track page views and session duration
Step 3: Log feature usage (export, search, version management)
Step 4: Monitor error rates and performance metrics
Step 5: Create dashboard for visualizing analytics data

description: Import sitemaps from external tools (Figma, Sketch)
steps: Step 1: Create import file upload functionality
Step 2: Support importing Figma plugin exports
Step 3: Parse and convert external format to internal tree structure
Step 4: Display imported tree in the visualization
Step 5: Verify the structure matches the original design

description: Create interactive demo with sample sitemaps
steps: Step 1: Create demo page with multiple sample sitemaps
Step 2: Add interactive examples showing different features
Step 3: Include tutorials for common workflows
Step 4: Add tooltips and contextual help
Step 5: Verify demos work and guide users effectively

description: Fix Jest configuration warnings for ts-jest
steps: Step 1: Update jest.config.cjs to use non-deprecated ts-jest configuration
Step 2: Move ts-jest config from globals to transform array
Step 3: Run tests and verify warnings are gone
Step 4: Verify all tests still pass
Step 5: Confirm build process completes without warnings
